title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel set in the Jazz Age, exploring themes of wealth and class.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice in the American South.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel about love and societal expectations in 19th-century England.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of adventure and obsession on the high seas.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic novel about a society driven by technology and control.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about adolescent angst and alienation.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure about the journey of Bilbo Baggins.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A gothic novel about the dangers of unchecked scientific ambition.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption.
